Like 'set_title_name', the new name is static and unchanging (i.e., if the localization key provided is 'Neo-[old_culture.GetName]' and the old culture is French, the new name is just be saved as a simple string, 'Neo-French', so that if/when the old_culture scope is cleaned up the localization does not break.set_culture_name = {

ordered_situation_group_participant.desc: Iterate through all characters that are part of a participation group in a situation.

random_situation_group_participant.desc: Iterate through all characters that are part of a participation group in a situation.

add_from_contribution_attackers.desc: Adds prestige, gold and piety based on contribution to allied attackers. parameters: prestige, gold, piety.

add_from_contribution_defenders.desc: Adds prestige, gold and piety based on contribution to allied defenders. parameters: prestige, gold, piety.

every_target_title.desc: Iterate through all casus belli's target titles

ordered_target_title.desc: Iterate through all casus belli's target titles

random_target_title.desc: Iterate through all casus belli's target titles

add_artifact_history.desc: Adds a history entry to the artifact, could for example be a reforging event
add_artifact_history.usage:
type = enum - history entry type
date = jomini date - when this historical event took place
actor = character - who is the actor in the event, for example who created it
recipient = character - who is the recipient in the event, for example who was the artifact given to
location = province - where the event took place

add_artifact_modifier.desc: Adds a static modifier to the given artifact

add_artifact_title_history.desc: Adds the title history of the given title to the scoped artifacts history

add_durability.desc: Add this much to the artifacts durability

clear_artifact_modifiers.desc: Removes all modifiers from the scoped artifact

copy_artifact_modifiers.desc: Copies the modifiers of the target artifact. Does *not* clear out existing modifiers

equip_artifact_to_owner.desc: Makes the owner of the scoped artifact equip it, will fail if there already is an equipment in the artifact's slot.

equip_artifact_to_owner_replace.desc: Makes the owner of the scoped artifact equip it, will replace the first held artifact if all slots of its type are filled.

every_artifact_claimant.desc: Iterate through all characters with a claim on the scoped artifact

every_artifact_house_claimant.desc: Iterate through all dynasty houses with a claim on the scoped artifact

ordered_artifact_claimant.desc: Iterate through all characters with a claim on the scoped artifact

ordered_artifact_house_claimant.desc: Iterate through all dynasty houses with a claim on the scoped artifact

random_artifact_claimant.desc: Iterate through all characters with a claim on the scoped artifact

random_artifact_house_claimant.desc: Iterate through all dynasty houses with a claim on the scoped artifact

reforge_artifact.desc: Reforges the given artifact, restoring its durability and potentially changing any other attributes such as type or modifiers unless those fields are left empty
reforge_artifact.usage:
name = dynamic description - artifact name
description = dynamic description - artifact description
rarity = enum - artifact rarity, ex. legendary
type = flag - inventory slot type, ex. trinket
modifier = static modifier - applied to the character whom wields this artifact
durability = script value - new durability, will be max by default
max_durability = script value - Optional. A value for the max durability, which would override the one normally assigned by the defines
decaying = yes/no - Optional. Set if artifact decays with time. Yes by default
history = artifact history entry - custom history entry to denote for example that this is artifact was reforged by someone else than the owner
type = artifact history entry type - available types:
template = artifact scripted template - a scripted base template with triggers and modifiers
visuals = artifact visual type - how this artifact should appear visually
generate_history = bool - automatically generate a new history entry if none has been scripted?
quality = script value - new quality, used in AI scoring
wealth = script value - new wealth, used in AI scoring
creator = character scope - set a custom creator of the artifact ( default is the owner )
visuals_source = scope containing landed title, dynasty or house - set a source of coat of arms graphics for the artifact
reforge_artifact.notes: Be aware that we make use of the current scopes implicitly. This is done in common/artifacts/visuals

remove_artifact_feature_group.desc: Removes th feature from the specified group from the artifact.

remove_artifact_modifier.desc: Removes a static modifier to the given artifact

set_artifact_description.desc: Sets the description of the given artifact

set_artifact_feature.desc: Sets the specified feature on the artifact.
set_artifact_feature.notes: If there's already a feature of that group, it gets overridden.

set_artifact_feature_group.desc: Sets a feature from the specified group on the artifact.
set_artifact_feature_group.notes: Uses the current scopes. Uses the weighting from the group. If there's already a feature of that group, it gets overridden.

set_artifact_name.desc: Sets the name of the given artifact

set_artifact_rarity.desc: Sets the rarity of the scoped artifact. Note that this does not update graphics and the like

set_owner.desc: Change the artifacts owner and transfer it to the given character
set_owner.usage:
set_artifact_owner = {}
target = character scope - the new owner character
history = artifact history entry - custom history entry to denote for example that this is artifact was stolen rather than given
generate_history = bool - automatically generate a new history entry if none has been scripted?

set_should_decay.desc: Set if the scoped artifact should decay with time or not

unequip_artifact_from_owner.desc: Makes the owner of the scoped artifact unequip it.

every_killed_character.desc: Iterate through all kills of a character

ordered_killed_character.desc: Iterate through all kills of a character

random_killed_character.desc: Iterate through all kills of a character

add_internal_flag.desc: adds effect to be read internally (no effect in the gamestate)

add_title_law.desc: add law to scoped title, overriding any current law from the same group. DOES NOT apply law change costs and effects.

add_title_law_effects.desc: add law to scoped title, overriding any current law from the same group. DOES apply law change costs and effects.

add_to_global_variable_list.desc: Adds the event target to a variable list for the given duration
add_to_global_variable_list.usage: add_to_variable_list = { name = X target = Y days/weeks/months/years = Z }

add_to_list.desc: Adds the current scope to an arbitrarily-named list (or creates the list if not already present) to be referenced later in the (unbroken) event chain

add_to_local_variable_list.desc: Adds the event target to a variable list for the given duration
add_to_local_variable_list.usage: add_to_variable_list = { name = X target = Y days/weeks/months/years = Z }

add_to_temporary_list.desc: Adds the current scope to an arbitrarily-named list (or creates the list if not already present) to be referenced later in the same effect

add_to_variable_list.desc: Adds the event target to a variable list for the given duration
add_to_variable_list.usage: add_to_variable_list = { name = X target = Y days/weeks/months/years = Z }

assert_if.desc: Conditionally cause an assert during run time
assert_if.usage: assert_if = { limit = { X } text = Y }, where X is a trigger and Y is an optional string

assert_read.desc: Conditionally cause an assert during read time
assert_read.usage: assert_read = X, where X is yes or the string to be printed in the assert

break_betrothal.desc: Breaks the betrothal between the scope character to the target character, break_betrothal = target

change_global_variable.desc: Changes the value or a numeric variable

change_local_variable.desc: Changes the value or a numeric variable

change_title_holder.usage:
holder = Character that should get the title
change = 'previously created title_and_vassal_change', adds a title change, will not transfer vassals
take_baronies = yes # Optional; if set, will cause baronies to be taken (rather than vassalized) as well if this title is a county
government_base = character # Optional, if the character getting the title was unlanded, their new government

change_title_holder_include_vassals.usage:
holder = 'Character that should get the title'
change = 'previously created title_and_vassal_change', adds a title change, will transfer vassals
take_baronies = yes # Optional; if set, will cause baronies to be taken (rather than vassalized) as well if this title is a county
government_base = character # Optional, if the character getting the title was unlanded, their new government

change_variable.desc: Changes the value or a numeric variable

clamp_global_variable.desc: Clamps a variable the specified max and min
clamp_global_variable.usage: clamp_variable = { name = X max = Y min = Z }

clamp_local_variable.desc: Clamps a variable the specified max and min
clamp_local_variable.usage: clamp_variable = { name = X max = Y min = Z }

clamp_variable.desc: Clamps a variable the specified max and min
clamp_variable.usage: clamp_variable = { name = X max = Y min = Z }

clear_saved_scope.desc: Clears a saved scope from the top scope

clear_traits.desc: Removes all traits for the character. clear_traits = yes

close_view.desc: Tries to close the defined view.
close_view.notes: Take care to set player if effect is executed not through UI but through synchronized code. Else all the window will open for all players.

copy_traits.desc: Adds all traits of the target to the character. Skips any traits that the character isn't allowed to have. Will not remove the character's existing traits. copy_traits = scope:character

create_accolade.desc: Create an accolade for the scoped character with the given knight and types. The name is an optional loc key, a default name will be generated otherwise.
create_accolade.usage: create_accolade = { knight = scope:character primary = accolade_type secondary = accolade_type name = loc_key }

create_adventurer_title.desc: Create a title for a landless adventurer.
create_adventurer_title.usage:
create_adventurer_title = \"
name = key/dynamic description
holder = <character> (intended holder of the new title)
government = administrative_government # optional government, default is adventurer
save_scope_as = <name>
prefix = key/dynamic description (optional; name used if not specified)
adjective = key/dynamic description (optional; name used if not specified)

create_betrothal.desc: Betroth the scope character to the target character, create_betrothal = target (at least one of the characters need to not be adult)

create_betrothal_matrilineal.desc: Betroth the scope character to the target character matrilineally, create_betrothal_matrilineal = target (at least one of the characters need to not be adult)

create_character.usage:
save_event_target_as = flag - save the character as an event target
save_temporary_event_target_as = flag - save the character as a temporary event target
name =
age =
gender = male/female/character scope
gender_female_chance = script_value - Range (0..100)
opposite_gender = character scope
trait = add this trait
random_traits_list = { count = { 1 5 } traitID = { some triggers } traitID = { some triggers } } - A number of traits specified by count (1 if not specified) will be picked from the traits that have their triggers met. Scopes are the same as where create_character is used. More than one grouping like this can be defined
random_traits = yes/no
health =
fertility =
mother =
father =
real_father = (should only be set if the real father is not the same as father=)
employer = will end up in this court, will become a pool character unless specified or father/mother is landed
location = pool province; mutually exclusive with employer
template_character =
faith = faith tag OR a faith scope
random_faith = { catholic = { some triggers } cathar = { some triggers }. Random one where the triggers are met will be picked. Scopes are the same as where create_character is used
random_faith_in_religion = religion tag OR a faith scope (there's no religion scope)
culture = culture name OR a culture scope
random_culture = { norse = { some triggers } norwegian = { some triggers }. Random one where the triggers are met will be picked. Scopes are the same as where create_character is used
random_culture_in_group = culture group name OR a culture scope (there's no group scope)
dynasty_house = dynasty house name OR a dynasty house scope
dynasty = generate/inherit/none - What to do if dynasty_house is not specified. generate by default.
ethnicity = culture/mother/father/parents/<ethnicity> - How to select ethnicity, culture by default.
ethnicities = { <key> = { some_triggers } } - Pick randomly from these ethnicities instead.
martial/diplomacy/intrigue...  =  will get random unless specified
after_creation = { some effects } run after character is created. Scope starts off in the character, with the scope it was created in as PREV, and the same top scope and saved targets etc.

create_dynamic_title.usage:
create_dynamic_title = {
tier = <tier>
name = key/dynamic description
adj = key/dynamic description (optional; name used if not specified)
pre = key/dynamic description (optional)
article = key/dynamic description (optional)
create_dynamic_title.notes: The title will be saved to scope:new_titleusage:

create_holy_order.usage:
create_holy_order = {
leader = scope:a_character
capital = scope:a_barony_title
name = <name> #Optional
coat_of_arms = <coa_name> #Optional
save_scope_as/save_temporary_scope_as = new_holy_order # optional way to get a reference to the new holy order

create_nomad_title.desc: Create a title for a nomad.
create_nomad_title.usage:
create_nomad_title = \"
name = key/dynamic description
holder = <character> (intended holder of the new title)
government = administrative_government # optional government, default is herder_government
save_scope_as = <name>
prefix = key/dynamic description (optional; name used if not specified)
adjective = key/dynamic description (optional; name used if not specified)

create_title_and_vassal_change.desc: starts a title and vassal change and saves it as a temporary event target
create_title_and_vassal_change.usage:
create_title_and_vassal_change = {
type = conquest (or other type)
save_scope_as = change (name of resulting saved scope)
add_claim_on_loss = yes (optional)

custom_description.desc: Wraps effects that get a custom description instead of the auto-generated one
custom_description.usage:
custom_description = {
text = <effect_localization_key>
subject = <optional subject scope> #defaults to current scope
object = <optional object scope>
value = <optional script value>

custom_description_no_bullet.desc: Wraps effects that get a custom description instead of the auto-generated one. Also ensures no bullet point appears
custom_description_no_bullet.usage:
custom_description_no_bullet = {
text = <effect_localization_key>
subject = <optional subject scope> #defaults to current scope
object = <optional object scope>
value = <optional script value>

custom_label.desc: just a tooltip, the scope as object (for grouping, localization). Can also be written as custom_label = { text = key subject = scope (optional) <hidden effects> }

custom_tooltip.desc: just a tooltip, the scope as subject (for grouping, localization). Can also be written as custom_tooltip = { text = key subject = scope (optional) <hidden effects> }

debug_log.desc: Log a string to the debug log when this effect executes, debug_log = message, the message can be a localization string with ROOT, SCOPE and PREV available

debug_log_date.desc: Logs the current date to the debug.log

debug_log_scopes.desc: Log the current scope to the debug log when this effect executes yes = full scope info, no=only current scope

debug_trigger_event.desc: Like trigger_event, except it'll print the trigger fulfillment and immediate effects of the event too

destroy_artifact.desc: Destroy given artifact, regardless of owner.

destroy_character_memory.notes: Destroys the targeted character memory, do not use the destroyed scope after calling this since it will have been removed

destroy_inspiration.notes: Destroys the targeted inspiration, do not use the destroyed scope after calling this since it will have been removed

destroy_owned_artifact.desc: Destroy artifact owned by character. Safer version of 'destroy_artifact'.

divorce.desc: Divorces the scope character from the target character. divorce = target

duel.desc: duel effect that selects an effect based on comparing specified skill(s), and/or saved variable(s) on, of a character to a value or another character's skill(s). Alternatively, the compare value can be scripted completely
duel.usage:
duel = {
skill = X
(skills = { X1 X2 ... })
challenge_variable = saved_variable_name
(challenge_variables = { saved_variable_name_1 saved_variable_name_2 ... })
target = Y
value = Z
localization = W
If localization = W is specified, the effect localization W will be used (entry in effect_localization database, not a localization key directly).

else.desc: Executes enclosed effects if limit criteria of preceding 'if' or 'else_if' is not met

else_if.desc: Executes enclosed effects if limit criteria of preceding 'if' or 'else_if' is not met, and its own limit is met

end_inspiration_sponsorship.notes: Stops the sponsorship of the targeted inspiration

error_log.desc: Log a string to the error log when this effect executes, error_log = message, the message can be a localization string with ROOT, SCOPE and PREV available

add_truce_both_ways.desc: Sets the both-way truce against the specified character
add_truce_both_ways.usage: add_truce_both_ways = { character = X years/months/days = Y override = yes/no result = victory/defeat/white_peace casus_belli/war = Z }
add_truce_both_ways.notes: 'character' specifies the target character 'override' says whether it should replace the previous truce even if shorter 'years / months / days' sets the duration of the truce 'result' specifies the result from the scope character's point of view ('white_peace' by default) 'casus_belli' sets the casus belli scope that caused the truce, mutually exclusive with 'name' 'name' sets a custom description. Dynamic description with the current scope 'war' sets the war that caused the truce, mutually exclusive with 'casus_belli'

add_truce_one_way.desc: Sets the truce against the specified character
add_truce_one_way.usage: add_truce_one_way = { character = X years/months/days = Y override = yes/no result = victory/defeat/white_peace casus_belli/war = Z }
add_truce_one_way.notes: 'character' specifies the target character 'override' says whether it should replace the previous truce even if shorter 'years / months / days' sets the duration of the truce 'result' specifies the result from the scope character's point of view ('white_peace' by default) 'casus_belli' sets the casus belli scope that caused the truce, mutually exclusive with 'name' 'name' sets a custom description. Dynamic description with the current scope

appoint_court_position.usage:
recipient = character scope - target character to receive the title
court_position = court position type - court position type to assign the receiver

assign_council_task.desc: Assigns the target character to the council task

assign_councillor_type.desc: Assigns the target character to a council position of a specific type.
assign_councillor_type.usage:
If 'remove_existing_councillor = yes', any existing councillor is removed before assigning. (not fired)
assign_councillor_type = {
type = <council_position_type_key>
target = character_taking_the_position
fire_on_actions = [yes]
remove_existing_councillor = [no]

becomes_independent.desc: becomes and independent ruler. becomes_independent = { change = 'previously created title_and_vassal_change'

break_alliance.desc: Breaks the alliance with the target character

cancel_truce_both_ways.desc: Ends the truce against the specified character, and theirs against the scoped character. cancel_truce_both_ways = scope:character

cancel_truce_one_way.desc: Ends the truce against the specified character. cancel_truce_one_way = scope:character

change_age.desc: Changes the character's age by the given amount. Sets age to 0 if it'd end up below 0. Note that this will completely bypass birthday on-actions, age-related health, and so on, just like the console command

change_current_court_grandeur.desc: Changes the current court grandeur of a character with a royal court, clamped between NRoyalCourt::COURT_GRANDEUR_MIN and NRoyalCourt::COURT_GRANDEUR_MAX.

change_current_weight.desc: Change the current weight of the scoped character

change_diarchy_swing.desc: Change scales of power swing for the active diarchy

change_first_name.desc: Change the first name of a character
change_first_name.usage:
change_first_name = <localization_key>
change_first_name = scope:name/var:name # containing a flag with a localization key
change_first_name = { template_character = scope:character } # copy name from the template character

change_government.desc: changes the government type of a ruler

change_influence_experience.desc: changes influence experience of a character

change_influence_level.desc: changes the influence level of a character

change_influence_no_experience.desc: changes influence (without experience) of a character

change_liege.desc: = { liege = 'Character that should become the new liege' change = 'previously created title_and_vassal_change', adds a liege change

change_prison_type.desc: Changes the charater's prison type. Scoped character is the prisoner. Accepts any static modifier (see also improson effect).

change_strife_opinion.desc: Change strife opinion caused by the scoped character

change_target_weight.desc: Change the target weight of the scoped character

change_trait_rank.desc: Changes the trait rank = { trait = trait_group rank = change max = maximum new rank }

clear_designated_heir.desc: Remove any currently set designated heir of a character.

complete_activity_intent.notes: Complete the scoped character's current intent in their involved activity

consume_banish_reasons.desc: 'Consume' all banish reasons that the scoped character has on the target character. Until they get a new reason, they cannot banish the target again.

consume_divorce_reasons.desc: 'Consume' all divorce reason that the scoped character has on the target character. Until they get a new reason, they cannot divorce the target again.

consume_execute_reasons.desc: 'Consume' all execute reasons that the scoped character has on the target character. Until they get a new reason, they cannot execute the target again.

consume_imprisonment_reasons.desc: 'Consume' all imprisonment reasons that the scoped character has on the target character. Until they get a new reason, they cannot imprison the target again.

consume_revoke_title_reason.desc: 'Consume' 1 revoke title reason that the scoped character has on the target character.

copy_inheritable_appearance_from.desc: copies the inheritable appearance attributes (inheritable genes in the character's DNA string) from the target character to the scoped character

copy_localized_text.desc: Copies a piece of localized text from the target character for the given key.

create_alliance.desc: Create an alliance between the scoped character and the target. The allied through characters determine who gets checked against for if the alliance should persist or not.
create_alliance.usage:
create_alliance = {
target = scope
allied_through_owner = scope
allied_through_target = scope
create_alliance = scope

create_artifact.desc: Creates a new artifact and adds it to the inventory of the given character
create_artifact.usage:
name = dynamic description - artifact name
description = dynamic description - artifact description
rarity = enum - artifact rarity, ex. legendary
type = flag - inventory slot type, ex. trinket
modifier = static modifier - applied to the character whom wields this artifact
durability = script value - new durability, will be max by default
max_durability = script value - Optional. A value for the max durability, which would override the one normally assigned by the defines
decaying = yes/no - Optional. Set if artifact decays with time. Yes by default
history = artifact history entry - custom history entry to denote for example that this is artifact was reforged by someone else than the owner
type = artifact history entry type - available types:
template = artifact scripted template - a scripted base template with triggers and modifiers
visuals = artifact visual type - how this artifact should appear visually
generate_history = bool - automatically generate a new history entry if none has been scripted?
quality = script value - new quality, used in AI scoring
wealth = script value - new wealth, used in AI scoring
creator = character scope - set a custom creator of the artifact ( default is the owner )
visuals_source = scope containing landed title, dynasty or house - set a source of coat of arms graphics for the artifact
save_scope_as = new artifact - an optional way to get a reference to the newly created artifact
title_history = title - history entries of the given title will be added to the artifact history
title_history_date = game date - from which date onwards to copy historical entries from given title
creator = character scope - set a custom creator of the artifact ( default is the owner )
create_artifact.notes: Be aware that we make use of the current scopes implicitly. This is done in common/artifacts/visuals

create_cadet_branch.desc: The scope character creates a cadet branch of the house he is in [yes|no]

create_character_memory.desc: Creates a memory for the character of a given type and participants plus an optional duration. Saved as scope:new_memory.
create_character_memory.usage: create_character_memory = { type = memory_type participants = { tag = scope } duration = { years = 3 } }

create_confederation.desc: Creates a confederation and adds the scoped character as a member.
create_confederation.notes: The confederation will be saved to scope:new_confederation usage:

create_divergent_culture.desc: Creates a new divergent culture from the scope character's culture. The new culture will keep all pillars and traditions of the parent culture  it is up to the user to add or remove pillars and traditions as appropriate.The new divergent culture is saved as scope:new_culture.

create_divergent_culture_with_side_effec.desc: Creates a new divergent culture from the scope character's culture. This also incurs the cost, does conversion, and such, just as if you'd diverged via the UI. Unlike create_divergent_culture, it will change ethos and suchThe new culture is NOT saved as a scope due to technical limitations.

Creates a new divergent culture from the scope character's culture. Ignores the cost, does conversion, and such, just as if you'd diverged via the UI. Unlike create_divergent_culture, it will change ethos and suchThe new culture is NOT saved as a scope due to technical limitations.

create_faction.desc: the scoped character creates a faction of the specified type against the specified target, create_faction = { type = X target = Y }

create_hybrid_culture.desc: Creates a new hybrid culture from the scope character's culture and the RHS culture. The new culture will have a random mix of pillars and traditions from both, like when the AI hybridizes. The new hybrid culture is saved as scope:new_culture.

create_hybrid_culture_with_side_effects.desc: Creates a new hybrid culture from the scope character's culture and the RHS culture. The new culture will have a random mix of pillars and traditions from both, like when the AI hybridizes. This also incurs the cost, does conversion, and such, just as if you'd hybridized via the UI. The new hybrid culture is NOT saved as a scope due to technical limitations.

create_inspiration.notes: Creates an inspiration of a given type owned by scoped character, new inspiration is saved as scope:new_inspiration

create_legend.desc: Creates a new legend owned by the scoped character.
create_legend.usage:
create_legend = {
type = heroic
quality = famed
chronicle = chronicle_type
properties = {
<key> = scope
<key> = scope
protagonist = character # optional, defaults to scoped character
save_scope_as = new_legend # optional

create_legend_seed.usage:
create_legend_seed = {
type = heroic

properties = {

create_maa_regiment.desc: Create MaA regiment for a ruler.
create_maa_regiment.usage:
scope:ruler = {
create_maa_regiment = light_footmen
create_maa_regiment = {

title = scope:title
size = 5
create_maa_regiment.notes: If title is set, MaA will be created as title troops

create_story.desc: creates and initializes a story cycle with the current character as owner

create_task_contract.usage:
task_contract_type = TYPE_NAME
task_task_contract_tier = VALUE
location = PROVINCE_SCOPE
task_contract_employer = CHARACTER_SCOPE
destination = PROVINCE_SCOPE
target = CHARACTER_SCOPE
save_scope_as = new_task_contract # optional

death.desc: kills a character, death = { killer = X death_reason = Y artifact = Z }, where X is a character and Y is one of the death reason keys. Optionally artifact Z will be used as the killing artifact instead of the defaulted one from the killer's slot for that death reason's definition. Or death = natural which will pick a natural death reason to kill the character from.

decline_activity_invite.notes: The scoped character declines the invitation to the target activity

depose_diarch.desc: Current scoped diarch is deposed and replaced with the next from the line of succession

designate_diarch.desc: Designated target character as a future diarch

end_tributary.desc: Ends the scoped character's current tributary contract.

every_acclaimed_knight.desc: Iterate through all acclaimed knights employed by a given character

every_accolade.desc: Iterate through all ( active and inactive ) Accolades of a given liege character's Acclaimed Knights

every_active_accolade.desc: Iterate through all active Accolades of a given liege character's Acclaimed Knights

every_alert_creatable_title.desc: Iterate through all titles that can be created by the character. (only for alerts)

every_alert_usurpable_title.desc: Iterate through all titles that can be usurped by the character. (only for alerts)

every_ancestor.desc: Iterate through all the ancestors of the scope character up to 5 generations

every_available_task_contract.desc: Iterate through all task contracts of location of root province

every_character_active_contract.desc: Gets all accepted task contracts of the root character

every_character_artifact.desc: Iterate through all artifacts in a given characters inventory

every_character_epidemic.desc: Gets epidemics affecting the scoped character

every_character_situation.desc: Iterate through all situations that a character is participating in

every_character_struggle.desc: Iterate through all struggles that character is involved in. Optional: Narrow down the involvement status *_chracter_struggle = { involvement = involved | interloper }

every_character_task_contract.desc: Gets all task contracts of the scoped character

every_character_to_title_neighboring_and.desc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring county (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)
Scopes from a character to a neighboring duchy (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)
Scopes from a character to a neighboring empire (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)
Scopes from a character to a neighboring kingdom (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

every_character_to_title_neighboring_cou.desc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring county (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

every_character_to_title_neighboring_duc.desc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring duchy (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

every_character_to_title_neighboring_emp.desc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring empire (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

every_character_to_title_neighboring_kin.desc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring kingdom (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

every_character_trait.desc: Iterate through all traits a character has

every_claim.desc: Iterate through the titles of all claims held by a character; parameters: explicit = yes/no/all pressed = yes/no/all

every_claimed_artifact.desc: Iterate through all claimed artifacts of the scoped character

every_close_family_member.desc: Iterate through all the close family [father, mother, siblings, children, grandparents]

every_close_or_extended_family_member.desc: Iterate through all the close and extended relatives [father, mother, siblings, children, grandparents, uncles/aunts, nephew/niece, cousins]

every_consort.desc: Iterate through all consorts (concubines and spouses)

every_contact.desc: Iterate through all contact characters of the root character

every_court_position_candidate.desc: Iterate through all valid candidates for a court position type.

every_court_position_employer.desc: Iterates through all characters that employ the scoped character in any court position.

every_court_position_holder.desc: Iterates through all characters employed by the scoped character in the target court position.

every_courtier_away.desc: Iterate through all courtiers that are away

every_courtier_or_guest.desc: Iterate through all courtiers and guests (pool and foreign court guests)

every_de_jure_claim.desc: Iterate through all de jure claims for a character

every_diarchy_succession_character.desc: Iterate through all character in the diarchy line of succession.If there's no active diarchy or active one doesn't have succession,it iterates over regency candidates

every_directly_owned_province.desc: Iterate through all directly owned provinces

every_election_title.desc: Iterate through all titles the scoped character can vote on

every_equipped_character_artifact.desc: Iterate through all equipped artifacts in a given characters inventory

every_extended_family_member.desc: Iterate through all the extended family [uncles/aunts, nephew/niece, cousins]

every_foreign_court_guest.desc: Iterate through all guests visiting from another court (in contrast to pool_guest they have a liege)

every_former_concubine.desc: Iterate through all former concubines. Not persisted past death

every_former_concubinist.desc: Iterate through all former concubinists. Not persisted past death

every_general_councillor.desc: Iterate through all councillors that are not related to a skill

every_heir_title.desc: Iterate through all titles the scoped character is heir to

every_held_title.desc: Iterate through all held landed titles

every_hired_mercenary.desc: Iterate through all hired mercenary companies

every_home_court_hostage.desc: Iterate through all hostages currently abroad

every_hooked_character.desc: Iterate through all characters this character has a hook on

every_hostile_raider.desc: Iterate through anyone the character is hostile to due to their top-liege's realm having been raided

every_invited_activity.desc: Iterate through all activities a character has been invited to

every_known_secret.desc: Iterate through all secrets known by the character

every_land_neighboring_realm_with_tribut.desc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege; switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date. Includes land borders extended due to tributaries.

A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege; switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date. Includes land borders extended due to tributaries.

every_liege_or_above.desc: Iterate through all lieges above a character (skipping the character themselves)

every_memory.desc: Iterate through all memories of a character

every_neighboring_and_across_water_realm.desc: A sub-realm or realm bordering the scope character's realm (including across water) and has the same rank as the scope character (look for lieges of he owner of the land if necessary)

every_neighboring_and_across_water_top_l.desc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege (including across water); switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege (including across water); switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

every_neighboring_and_across_water_top_s.desc: A realm with a different top suzerain neighboring the realm of the scope character's top suzerain (including across water); switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

A realm with a different top suzerain neighboring the realm of the scope character's top suzerain (including across water); switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

every_neighboring_realm_same_rank_owner.desc: A sub-realm or realm bordering the scope character's realm and has the same rank as the scope character (look for lieges of he owner of the land if necessary)

every_neighboring_top_liege_realm.desc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege; switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

every_neighboring_top_liege_realm_owner.desc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege; switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

every_neighboring_top_suzerain_realm.desc: A realm with a different top suzerain neighboring the realm of the scope character's top suzerain; switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

every_neighboring_top_suzerain_realm_own.desc: A realm with a different top suzerain neighboring the realm of the scope character's top suzerain; switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

every_noble_family.desc: Iterate through all noble family titles in the realm of scoped character

every_opposite_sex_spouse_candidate.desc: Iterate through all the spouse candidates of the opposite sex of a character.

every_owned_story.desc: Iterate through all owned stories for a character

every_patroned_holy_order.desc: Iterate through all holy orders that the scoped character is a patron of

every_personal_claimed_artifact.desc: Iterate through all personally claimed artifacts of the scoped character

every_pinned_character.desc: Iterate through characters this player has pinned

every_pinning_character.desc: Iterate through characters whose player has this character pinned

every_played_character.desc: Iterate through all characters the player playing this character has played. Matches the game over legacy, except for excluding the currently played character

every_player_heir.desc: Iterate through player heirs, capped at the first 10

every_player_legend_library.desc: Get all legends in a player character library.

every_pool_guest.desc: Iterate through all guests visiting the court from the pool (in contrast to foreign_court_guest they don't have a liege)

every_potential_marriage_option.desc: Iterate through all potential selectable marriage or betrohed options

every_powerful_family.desc: Iterate through all directly owned provinces

every_powerful_vassal.desc: Iterate through the all powerful vassals of a character

every_pretender_title.desc: Iterate through all landed titles character is pretender to

every_primary_war_enemy.desc: Iterate through all primary war enemies

every_raid_target.desc: Iterate through anyone the character is hostile to due to having raided them. Only returns top lieges

every_realm_border_county.desc: Iterate through all counties that are on the edge of your realm bordering a different neighboring realm.

every_realm_county.desc: Iterate through all counties in the realm. Based on top liege

every_realm_de_jure_duchy.desc: Iterate through all de jure duchies that have at least one county in the realm. Based on top liege

every_realm_de_jure_empire.desc: Iterate through all de jure empire that have at least one county in the realm. Based on top liege

every_realm_de_jure_kingdom.desc: Iterate through all de jure kingdom that have at least one county in the realm. Based on top liege

every_realm_province.desc: Iterate through all realm provinces of a character

every_relation.desc: Iterate through scripted relations of a given type or multiple types, if someone is multiple relations they will only be in the list once

every_same_sex_spouse_candidate.desc: Iterate through all the spouse candidates of the same sex of a character.
every_same_sex_spouse_candidate.notes: WARNING: THIS IS VERY SLOW DO NOT DO IT OFTEN.

every_scheme.desc: Iterate through all schemes owned by the character

every_secret.desc: Iterate through all secrets of the character

every_spouse_candidate.desc: Iterate through all the spouse candidates of a character.
every_spouse_candidate.notes: WARNING: THIS IS VERY SLOW DO NOT DO IT OFTEN.

every_sub_realm_barony.desc: Iterate through all baronies in sub-realm

every_sub_realm_county.desc: Iterate through all counties in sub-realm

every_sub_realm_duchy.desc: Iterate through all duchies in sub-realm

every_sub_realm_empire.desc: Iterate through all empires in sub-realm

every_sub_realm_kingdom.desc: Iterate through all kingdoms in sub-realm

every_sub_realm_title.desc: Iterate through all titles in sub-realm

every_succession_appointment_invested_ca.desc: Iterate through all candidates supported by the scoped investor character for any title

every_succession_appointment_invested_ti.notes: It may contain titles outside of investor's top realm, and so invalid for appointment, and candidates may be already dead

every_targeting_faction.desc: Iterate through all factions targeting the scope character

every_targeting_scheme.desc: Iterate through all schemes targeting the character

every_targeting_secret.desc: Iterate through all secrets that target the specified scope

every_tax_collector.desc: Iterates through all Tax Collectors employed by the scoped character

every_tax_collector_vassal.desc: Iterates through all Vassals the scoped Character is the Tax Collector for

every_tax_slot.desc: Iterates through all Tax Slots the scoped character has

every_top_realm_border_county.desc: Iterate through all counties that are on the edge of your realm bordering a different neighboring top realm.

every_traveling_family_member.desc: Iterate though all characters that should travel with the scoped one (when moving between courts for instance); includes the scoped character

every_truce_holder.desc: Iterate through all characters that have a truce on this character

every_truce_target.desc: Iterate through all characters this character has a truce on

every_unassigned_taxpayers.desc: Iterates through all unassigned taxpayers for scoped Character

every_unspent_known_secret.desc: Iterate through all unspent secrets known by the character

every_vassal_or_below.desc: Iterate through ALL vassals, not just direct vassals

every_war_ally.desc: Iterate through all direct war allies

every_war_enemy.desc: Iterate through all direct war enemies

every_warden_hostage.desc: Iterate through all hostages having this warden

execute_decision.desc: Execute the specified decision for the scoped character

finish_council_task.desc: The councillor finish the current assigned task successfully.

fire_councillor.desc: The scope character fires the target character from the council.

fire_councillor_skip_effects.desc: The scope character fires the target character from the council without running on_actions.

fire_tax_collector.desc: The scoped character fires the target character.

forbid_from_scheme.desc: Forbid the scope character from joining the target scheme as an agent (and kick the character out if already in the scheme)

force_add_to_agent_slot.desc: Adds a character as an agent to a scheme agent slot and forces them to stay

force_character_skill_recalculation.desc: Forces a character's skills to be recalculated immediately, bypassing the wait for the daily tick.
force_character_skill_recalculation.notes: NOTE: Only use this when *absolutely* necessary, as it will impact performance negatively if misused

force_step_down_landed_titles.desc: Make ruler step down - less harsh than abdicate or depose.
force_step_down_landed_titles.notes: If ruler has any title that allows them to remain landless playable, then pass all landed titles to heirs - counties and any higher tier title with dejure land. Keep all titular titles. If no such title exists, then it works identical to depose

force_vote_as.desc: Forces the character to vote the same as the target

get_title.desc: gives a title to a character

give_domain_to_herders.desc: Give each county in the scoped character's domain to herders and destroy all held duchy titles and above.

give_nickname.desc: Give a nickname to this character

give_noble_family_title.desc: Give a noble family title to the <root> character.
give_noble_family_title.usage:
give_noble_family_title = {
name = key/dynamic description
government = administrative_government # optional government, default is administrative
save_scope_as = <name>

imprison.desc: Imprisons the target character as this character's prisoner, imprison = { target = X reason = Y type = Z }, where X is a character, Y is a flag, Z is a static modifier

infect_with_epidemic.desc: Infect the scoped character with the target epidemic.

invalidate_diarch_if_needed.desc: Immediately check if diarch should be invalidated
invalidate_diarch_if_needed.notes: If needed, current scoped diarch is removed and replaced with the next one from the line of succession

invite_to_activity.notes: The scoped character is invited to the target activity

join_faction.desc: the character in the scope joins the assigned faction

join_faction_forced.desc: the character in the scope is forced to join a faction by a character for a defined time,
join_faction_forced.usage:
join_faction_forced = {
faction = X
forced_by = Y
days/months/years = duration

join_faction_skip_check.desc: the character in the scope joins the assigned faction skiping the can_character_join trigger

learn_language.desc: The character learns the languagelearn_language = language_norwegian

learn_language_of_culture.desc: The character learns the language of the target culturelearn_language_of_culture = scope:target_culture

leave_faction.desc: the charcter in the scope leaves the assigned faction

make_claim_strong.desc: makes a claim strong (character adds the claim if not having it already)

make_claim_weak.desc: makes a claim weak (character adds the claim if not having it already)

make_concubine.desc: Makes the target character a concubine of the scope character, the target should not be imprisoned

make_pregnant.usage:
father= 'the real father'
number_of_children= X
known_bastard=yes/no

make_pregnant_no_checks.desc: makes a character pregnant. Doesn't error on things like celibacy
make_pregnant_no_checks.usage:
father= 'the real father'
number_of_children= X
known_bastard=yes/no

make_trait_active.desc: Activates an inactive trait. Tooltip will not be shown if the character cannot have the trait.

make_trait_active_force_tooltip.desc: Activates an inactive trait. Tooltip will be shown even if the character cannot have the trait.

make_trait_inactive.desc: Makes a current trait of a character inactive. Tooltip will not be shown if the character doesn't have the trait.

make_trait_inactive_force_tooltip.desc: Makes a current trait of a character inactive. Tooltip will be shown even if the character doesn't have the trait.

make_unprunable.desc: The scope character will no longer be prunable after their death. Use with care, as this will make everyone related to them unprunable too. So you should only use this if someone absolutely *needs* to stick around several years after their death. Example: make_unprunable = yes

marry.desc: Marries the scoped character to the target character.

marry_matrilineal.desc: Marries the scoped character to the target character matrilineally.

move_budget_gold.desc: Move gold from one AI budget category to the other, will not move more than is available in the source budget or what can fit in the target budget.character, move_budget_gold = { gold = X from = Z to = Y }

remove_concubine.desc: Removes the target character as a concubine of the scope character

remove_courtier_or_guest.desc: Removes the target character (guest or courtier) from the scope character's court

remove_dead_character_variable.notes: Remove a variable from a dead character.

remove_decision_cooldown.desc: Remove the cooldown on taking a decision for the scoped character

remove_from_activity.notes: The scoped character is removed from the target activity

remove_hook.desc: Removes a hook on a character, remove_hook = { target = X, type = Y }, if type is specified, the hook will only be removed if it is of that type

remove_interaction_cooldown.desc: Remove the cooldown on using an interaction for the scoped character

remove_interaction_cooldown_against.desc: Remove the cooldown on using an interaction against the target character for the scoped character

remove_localized_text.desc: Removes a piece of localized text from being stored on the character with a given key, you should do this whenever you are done with the custom text so as to not bloat saves

remove_long_term_gold.desc: removes gold from a character (from AI's 'long term' budget first, then rest)

remove_nickname.desc: Removes any nickname from the current character [yes|no]

remove_opinion.desc: Removes a temporary opinion modifier, remove_opinion = { target = X modifier = Y single = Z (no by default) } where X is a character, Y is the opinion modifier, Z tells whether to remove all instances of the modifier or just one

remove_perk.desc: Remove the perk for this character

remove_personal_artifact_claim.desc: Removes a personal claim on the target artifact from the scoped character

remove_realm_law.desc: Removes the given law from the scoped character. This will leave the law group empty, so only do this if you're getting rid of a law group

remove_relation_flag.desc: Removed a flag from an existing relation flag = flag_name (declared in scripted_relation) target = other_character relation = scripted_relation

remove_reserved_gold.desc: removes gold from a character (from AI's 'reserved' budget first, then rest)

remove_scheme_cooldown_against.desc: Remove the cooldown on using a scheme against the target character for the scoped character

remove_short_term_gold.desc: removes gold from a character (from AI's 'short term' budget first, then rest)

remove_trait.desc: Removes a trait from a character. Tooltip will not be shown if the character doesn't have the trait.

remove_trait_force_tooltip.desc: Removes a trait from a character. Tooltip will be shown even if the character doesn't have the trait.

remove_war_chest_gold.desc: removes gold from a character (from AI's 'war chest' budget first, then rest)

replace_court_position.desc: Replaces the target character holding target court position within scoped character's court with target character
replace_court_position.usage:
recipient = character scope - target character to receive the title
holder = character scope - target character to revoke the target court position of in favour of recipient
court_position = court position type - court position type to assign the receiver

reset_beneficiary.desc: The target character stops having a beneficiary. reset_beneficiary = yes

return_home.desc: Start a travel plan for the character to return home, using their current travel plan info if they have any or starting a new travel plan if they do not.
return_home.notes: Saving this as a scope will not work for player characters if they have to use the planner.

return_hostage.desc: Release scoped character from hostage and return to home court

return_to_court.desc: Returns the scope character to the employers court.

reverse_add_opinion.desc: Adds a temporary reverse opinion modifier, reverse_add_opinion = { modifier = X days/months/years = Y target = Z }
reverse_add_opinion.notes: X is a scripted modifier name. Y can be a value or a range "{ A B }" If no timeout are specified, the modifier's scripted default timeout will be used.

revoke_court_position.desc: Revokes target position from scoped character.
revoke_court_position.usage:
court_position = court position type - court position type to revoke from scoped character's court
recipient = character - optional - target current holder of position to revoke
holder = character - optional - same as recipient

scriptedtests_recalculate_character_modi.desc: Recalculates the modifier of the scoped character

scriptedtests_recalculate_succession.desc: Recalculates the line of succession of the scoped character

send_interface_message.desc: Sends a message to the player playing the character in the scope and then executes any effects inside.
send_interface_message.usage:
send_interface_message = {
type = message_type # default: send_interface_message
title = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
desc = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
tooltip = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
left_icon = scope:recipient # optional, character, artifact, or title
right_icon = scope:the_title # optional, character, artifact, or title
add_dread = 5
scope:someone = { add_gold = 5 }
send_interface_message.notes: For the message text and tooltip, $EFFECT$ contains the text description of the effects in the past tense. And $DESC$ contains the text from the desc field.

send_interface_popup.desc: Sends a message to the player playing the character in the scope and then executes any effects inside.
send_interface_popup.usage:
send_interface_popup = {
type = message_type # default: send_interface_popup
title = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
desc = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
tooltip = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
left_icon = scope:recipient # optional, character, artifact, or title
right_icon = scope:the_title # optional, character, artifact, or title
add_dread = 5
scope:someone = { add_gold = 5 }
send_interface_popup.notes: For the message text and tooltip, $EFFECT$ contains the text description of the effects in the past tense. And $DESC$ contains the text from the desc field.

send_interface_toast.desc: Sends a message to the player playing the character in the scope and then executes any effects inside.
send_interface_toast.usage:
send_interface_toast = {
type = message_type # default: send_interface_toast
title = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
desc = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
tooltip = LOCALIZATION # optional, otherwise takes it from the message type
left_icon = scope:recipient # optional, character, artifact, or title
right_icon = scope:the_title # optional, character, artifact, or title
add_dread = 5
scope:someone = { add_gold = 5 }
send_interface_toast.notes: For the message text and tooltip, $EFFECT$ contains the text description of the effects in the past tense. And $DESC$ contains the text from the desc field.

set_absolute_country_control.desc: Sets if this character has absolute country control, unlock_character_movement = yes/no/boolean event target

set_age.desc: Sets the character's age. Note that this will completely bypass birthday on-actions, age-related health, and so on, just like the console command

set_amenity_level.notes: Sets the amenity type to the given value for the scoped character

set_beneficiary.desc: The target character becomes the beneficiary of the scoped character. set_beneficiary = some character

set_character_faith.desc: Changes what faith a character has executing the effects for it. For history setup use 'set_character_faith_history' instead.

set_character_faith_history.desc: Changes what faith a character has NOT executing the effects for it. USE ONLY IN HISOTRY SETUP!

set_character_faith_with_conversion.desc: Changes what faith a character has, as if they used the faith-view interaction (minus the piety cost). So vassals who'd accept will get converted, as will capitals

set_child_of_concubine_on_pregnancy.desc: Sets the child to be (or not be) a child of a concubine during pregnancy

set_council_task.desc: Sets the task of the scope councillor { task_type = council_position_type_key target = for_targeted_tasks  }

set_court_language.desc: Set the character's court language to the given languageset_court_language = language_norwegian

set_court_type.desc: Set the court type for this character's royal court

set_culture.desc: Set the culture for this character

set_culture_same_as.desc: sets the culture of the character to be the same as the culture of the target

set_current_court_grandeur.desc: Sets the current court grandeur of a character with a royal court, clamped between NRoyalCourt::COURT_GRANDEUR_MIN and NRoyalCourt::COURT_GRANDEUR_MAX.
set_current_court_grandeur.notes: Does not apply a grace period, and removes any existing one.

set_dead_character_variable.usage:
name = <name> - name of the variable
value = <value> - any event target, bool, value, script value or flag
years/weeks/days = { <min_number> <max_number> } - years/weeks/days this flag is supposed to last

set_death_reason.desc: set_death_reason = { killer = X death_reason = Y artifact = Z }
set_death_reason.notes: All parameters are optional. Sets the death reason, the killer, and artifact used in the death of a dead character

set_default_education.desc: Set the default education focus for this character

set_designated_heir.desc: Sets one the given direct child character as designated heir.

set_designated_heir_unsafe.desc: Sets the given character as designated heir. This is unsafe if the designated heirs loop. Ensure that there is no loop of heirs when using this. This is purely for mod supports and designers should never use this.

set_diarch.desc: Set target character as new diarch. Requires an active diarchy

set_diarchy_mandate.desc: Set mandate for the diarch. Takes mandate type as argument

set_diarchy_swing.desc: Set scales of power swing for the active diarchy

set_diarchy_type.desc: Set diarthy type for the character. Takes diarchy type as argument

set_employer.desc: Add the scope character to the target character's court

set_ethnicity.desc: Set the ethnicity for this character, if it is of a different portrait group and they have DNA it will be randomized

set_father.desc: sets the father of a character

set_focus.desc: Set the focus for this character

set_house.desc: Sets the dynasty house of the character

set_immortal_age.desc: Changes what age the character became immortal at. Only works if already immortal

set_killer_public.desc: Sets the scoped character's killer as being publicly known

set_knight_status.desc: Sets the knight status of the character to Forced/Default/Disallowed

set_known_bastard_on_pregnancy.desc: Sets the child to a known or unknown bastard during pregnancy

set_location.desc: Moves the character to a specific location.
set_location.usage:
stick_to_location can be used to prevent the safety checks that sometimes return characters to their default location automatically.Usage:   set_location = province
set_location = { location = province   stick_to_location = yes/no }

set_location_to_default.desc: Moves the character to its "default" location.This is usually the realm capital for landed characters, or court location for courtiers.

set_mother.desc: Sets the mother of a character

set_override_designated_winner.desc: The scoped character will put their beneficiary on the throne if they're the #1 participant if this is called with 'yes'. Call with 'no' to turn it off again. set_override_designate_winner = yes/no

set_owned_legend.desc: Sets the owner of the target legend to the scoped character.

set_player_character.desc: The scope character's player will now play as the target character. Scope must be player-controlled. Target cannot be player-controlled. Example:set_player_character = scope:title_recipient

set_pregnancy_assumed_father.desc: Set the assumed father of the pregnancy

set_primary_spouse.desc: Set the primary spouse of a character

set_primary_title_to.desc: Sets the primary title for a character

set_promoted_legend.desc: Adds the scoped character as a promoter of the target legend.

set_real_father.desc: Changes the real father of the scoped character

set_real_mother.desc: Changes the real mother of the scoped character

set_relation_activity_recurrer.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_antiquarian.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_old_flame.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_potential_hook.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_potential_lover.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_student.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_victim.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_ward.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_wedding_bad_fertility.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_relation_wedding_good_fertility.desc: Sets scripted relationship, set_relation_xxx = target, set_relation_xxx = { target = target reason = reason_key copy_reason = optional_other_relation province = optional_province involved_character = optional_character }

set_reserved_gold_maximum.desc: Set the maximum (and also desired value) for the 'reserved' gold AI budget. This budget is saved up, even before the war chest budget. It will not correct the current gold in that budget to conform to the new maximum.character, set_reserved_gold_maximum = X

set_sexuality.desc: Sets the sexuality of the character

set_subject_contract_modification_blocke.desc: Blocks the subject contract from being modified with regards to being checked by 'subject_contract_is_blocked_from_modification'

set_trait_rank.desc: Sets the trait rank = { trait = trait_group rank = new rank }

set_vassal_contract_modification_blocked.desc: Blocks the vassal contract from being modified with regards to being checked by 'vassal_contract_is_blocked_from_modification'

spawn_army.desc: Spawns an army for this character. If the character is not at war, the regiments will be created, but the army will not be spawned.
spawn_army.usage:
spawn_army = {
levies = int/script value # optional, number of men
men_at_arms = { # optional, multiple can be specified. Need either levies or MAA
type = key
men/stacks = int/script value
location = province
origin = province # optional, location used if not set. This is used for where to base bonuses and the like on
war = war # optional. If set, the stack will disband after the war ends
war_keep_on_attacker_victory = yes/no # Default: no. Tied to a war. Normally the stack will disband upon victory (if a war is specified), but this parameter prevents that from happening upon attacker victory
inheritable = yes/no # Default: yes
uses_supply = yes/no # Default: yes
army = army # optional. If set, the stack will merge into this army
save_scope_as/save_temporary_scope_as = new_army # optional way to get a reference to the new army. Note this might not be set if the army wasn't spawned (e.g. if the character is not at war)
name = description # gives the troops a specific name that shows up in interfaces

sponsor_inspiration.notes: Sets the sponsor of the target inspiration to the scoped character

start_default_task.desc: Force the Councillor to revert to the default task. Any relevant percentage progress will be lost (even if the councillor was performing the default task already).

start_scheme.usage:
contract = (Optional) CONTRACTtarget_character = CHARACTER
target_title = TITLE
target_culture = CULTURE
target_faith = FAITH
targets_nothing = yes/no (default no) }
Only one target can be specified (or 0 if target_nothing = yes)

start_travel_plan.desc: Start a travel plan. Saving this as a scope will not work for player characters if they have to use the planner.
start_travel_plan.usage:
start_travel_plan = {
destination = scope:province (repeatable)
travel_leader = scope:character (optional)
companion = scope:character (optional & repeatable)
travel_with_domicile = no
players_use_planner = yes
return_trip = yes
can_cancel_planning = yes
on_arrival_event = event_id
on_arrival_on_action = onaction_id
on_start_event = event_id
on_start_on_action = onaction_id
on_travel_planner_cancel_event = event_id
on_travel_planner_cancel_on_action = onaction_id
on_arrival_destinations = all_but_last/all/first/last

start_war.desc: starts a war  = { casus_belli/cb = X target = Y claimant = Z target_title = W1 target_title = W2 ... } where X is a casus belli type, Y is the target character, Z i the (optional) claimant, W1, W2.... are targeted titles.
start_war.notes: If there are no title targets, the effect will pick one of possible title targets.

stop_promoting_legend.desc: Remove the scoped character as the owner/promoter of their current promoted legend if they have one.

store_localized_text_in_death.desc: Makes a piece of localized text with the given key be stored on the character even after death, you should use this sparingly to avoid save bloat and use 'remove_localized_text' if you no longer need itsaves

stress_impact.desc: Stress impact according to specified traits (trait = value), use base = value for a base value that's always added

take_hostage.desc: Take target character as a hostagescope:warden = { take_hostage = scope:hostage }

tributary_contract_set_obligation_level.desc: change the obligation level of the scoped character's tributary contract

try_start_diarchy.desc: Attempts to start a diarchy for the character. Takes diarchy type as argument
try_start_diarchy.usage:
Use `exists = my_ruler_scope.diarch` to test if it's valid afterwards if needed.
start_diarchy = regency
try_start_diarchy.notes: NB: this effect will silently fail if a valid diarch cannot be found.

unlearn_court_language_of.desc: The character unlearns the court language of the target character. Cannot unlearn the language of your cultureunlearn_court_language_of = scope:target_character

unlearn_language.desc: The character unlearns the language. Cannot unlearn the language of your cultureunlearn_language = language_norwegian

unlearn_language_of_culture.desc: The character unlearns the language of the target culture. Cannot unlearn the language of your cultureunlearn_language_of_culture = scope:target_culture

use_hook.desc: Uses a hook a character has (removes if weak, puts on cooldown if strong), use_hook = some_character

vassal_contract_decrease_obligation_leve.desc: decrease the obligation level of the scoped character's vassal contract

vassal_contract_increase_obligation_leve.desc: increase the obligation level of the scoped character's vassal contract

vassal_contract_set_obligation_level.desc: change the obligation level of the scoped character's vassal contract

visit_court_of.desc: Add the scope character as the target character's guest

every_combat_side.desc: Iterate over both sides ( attacker and defender ) of the given combat

ordered_combat_side.desc: Iterate over both sides ( attacker and defender ) of the given combat

random_combat_side.desc: Iterate over both sides ( attacker and defender ) of the given combat

add_county_modifier.desc: Add a modifier to a county
add_county_modifier.usage:
add_county_modifier = name
add_county_modifier = { modifier = name days/weeks/months/years = int }

change_appointment_investment.desc: Increase appointment score of a character for a title
change_appointment_investment.usage:
change_appointment_investment = {
target = scope:target_character
investor = scope:investor_character # Optional, the character who made this investment
value = <script_value>

change_county_control.desc: Changes the county control of a title. If the title has higher tier than county, the effect will propagate down to all counties below it.

change_county_fertility.desc: Changes the County Fertility of the scoped county title by the given amount

change_de_jure_drift_progress.desc: Change the progress of de jure drift of a title<drifting_title> = { change_de_jure_drift_progress = {    target = <drift_target_title>    values = <progress_change_value> } }

change_development_level.desc: Changes the development level of a title. If the title has higher tier than county, the effect will propagate down to all counties below it.

change_development_progress.desc: Changes the development progress of a title. If the title has higher tier than county, the effect will propagate down to all counties below it.

change_development_progress_with_overflo.desc: Changes the development progress of a title. If the title has higher tier than county, the effect will propagate down to all counties below it. Will overflow, so adding +100 to a county with 50 progress left will increase the level by 1 and result in 50 progress towards the next level

clear_title_laws.desc: remove all title laws from the scoped title. DOES NOT apply law removal costs and effects.

clear_title_laws_effects.desc: remove all title laws from the scoped title. DOES apply law removal costs and effects.

copy_title_history.desc: Copy title history from another title

every_claimant.desc: Iterate through all claimants to title. parameters: explicit = yes/no/all - default yes

every_connected_county.desc: Iterate through all counties connected to this one. Is based on top liege

every_controlled_faith.desc: Iterate through all faiths headed by a title

every_county_province.desc: Iterate through all provinces in a county

every_county_situation.desc: Iterate through all situations that a county is involved in.

every_county_situation_sub_region.desc: Iterate through all situation sub-regions that a county is involved in.

every_county_struggle.desc: Iterate through all struggles that a county is involved in.

every_de_jure_county.desc: Iterate through all counties within this dejure title

every_de_jure_county_holder.desc: Iterate through all characters directly holding counties within this dejure title

every_de_jure_top_liege.desc: Iterate through all top lieges of the counts within this dejure title

every_dejure_vassal_title_holder.desc: Iterate through all the vassal holders of the title

every_direct_de_facto_vassal_title.desc: Iterate through all de facto vassal titles

every_direct_de_jure_vassal_title.desc: Iterate through the all de jure vassals titles

every_election_candidate.desc: Iterate through all characters who are valid candidates in an election for a title

every_elector.desc: Iterate through all characters who are valid electors in an election for a title

every_important_location_for_title.desc: Iterate through all counties that are important for the scoped title

every_in_de_facto_hierarchy.desc: Iterate through the title itself, all de facto vassals, and below. The continue trigger specifies whether to recursively iterate through the vassal's vassal
every_in_de_facto_hierarchy.notes: This is unrelated to the limit; if the limit is met it is added to the list, but its vassals will get checked even if the limit isn't met as long as the 'continue' trigger is

every_in_de_jure_hierarchy.desc: Iterate through the title itself, all de jure vassals, and below. The continue trigger specifies whether to recursively iterate through the vassal's vassal

every_neighboring_county.desc: Iterate through all neighboring counties. Can only be used in county scope

every_owned_title_maa_regiment.desc: Iterate through owned title MaA regiments

every_past_holder.desc: Iterate through all past owners of a title from earliest to latest

every_past_holder_reversed.desc: Iterate through all past owners of a title from latest to earliest

every_succession_appointment_investors.desc: Iterate through all investors of target candidate within the scoped title. Optionally specify a value to filter by investment amount

every_this_title_or_de_jure_above.desc: Iterate through this title and all its dejure liege titles

every_title_heir.desc: Line of succession for the scoped title
